title: Job Reflects on the Frailty of Life
summary: Job speaks about the brevity and sorrow of life. He compares humans to flowers that wither and wishes for hope beyond the grave. He longs for a day when God would hide him until His wrath is over.

faq.question: What themes are central in this chapter?
faq.answer: The frailty of human life, death, and longing for hope and restoration.

faq.question: Does Job express any hope here?
faq.answer: Yes, he briefly imagines a future resurrection or restoration beyond the grave.
